publicwhip.spmotion: * S3M-6076 Bill Kidd: Employment and Support Allowance Still Isn’t Working—That the Parliament welcomes the report, Not Working - CAB evidence on the ESA work capability assessment, in association with Mind and endorsed by Action for blind people, Action for M.E, the Child Poverty Action Group, Carers UK, Disability Alliance, the Disability Benefits Consortium, Leonard Cheshire Disability, Macmillan Cancer Support, Mencap, the Multiple Sclerosis Society, the National AIDS Trust, the National Autistic Society, NDCS, the Parkinson’s Disease Society, Radar, RNIB and RSI Action, which recommends that "There should be a full and independent review of the work capability assessment (WCA) which looks at not just the individual descriptors but at the underlying questions of who should be eligible for the benefit, the validity of the test at identifying those people and the accuracy of the medical assessments."

S3M-6076 Bill Kidd: Employment and Support Allowance Still Isn’t Working—That the Parliament welcomes *Citizens Advice England and Wales’* report, Not Working - CAB evidence on the ESA work capability assessment, in association with Mind and endorsed by Action for blind people, Action for M.E, the Child Poverty Action Group, Carers UK, Disability Alliance, the Disability Benefits Consortium, Leonard Cheshire Disability, Macmillan Cancer Support, Mencap, the Multiple Sclerosis Society, the National AIDS Trust, the National Autistic Society, NDCS, the Parkinson’s Disease Society, Radar, RNIB and RSI Action, which recommends that "There should be a full and independent review of the work capability assessment (WCA) which looks at not just the individual descriptors but at the underlying questions of who should be eligible for the benefit, the validity of the test at identifying those people and the accuracy of the medical assessments." Supported by: Michael Matheson*, Aileen Campbell*, Christine Grahame*, Dave Thompson*, Stuart McMillan*, Bob Doris*
